criticism: Integer overflow in mintToken function allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value, causing a potential exploitation where attackers can mint arbitrary amounts of tokens.
transferFrom function allows asset theft due to incorrect computations of allowance. Attackers can transfer tokens to arbitrary addresses.
buy function does not use random numbers, allowing attackers to always buy the same amount of tokens. Attackers can exploit this issue to always win the lottery.
sell function allows asset theft due to incorrect access control on 'this'. Attackers can exploit this issue to steal a large amount of tokens.
setPrices function allows attackers to set arbitrary sell and buy prices. Attackers can exploit this issue to manipulate the token price.
